alternateName: Time-series Solvent Selection Data for Few-shot Machine Learning

distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Catechol Benchmark dataset

distribution.name: acs_pca_descriptors_lookup.csv
distribution.description: Translation of solvent names to the ML-readable representation: ACS Solvent Selection Guide's principle component analysis representation (ACS PCA)

distribution.name: catechol_full_data_yields.csv
distribution.description:
Full data set with mixture solvents.

| Name | Type | Description |
|--------|--------|--------|
| `EXP NUM` | int| Experiment index; all rows with the same `EXP NUM` will use the same solvent|
| `SOLVENT {A/B} NAME` | str | Chemical name of the solvents; used as a key when looking up featurizations|
| `SolventB%` | float | Percent concentration of solvent B; the rest of the solvent is made up of solvent A|
| `Residence Time` | float | Time (in minutes) of the reaction|
| `Temperature`| float | Temperature (in Celsius) of the reaction|
| `SM` | float | Quantity of starting material measured (yield %)|
| `Product {2/3}` | float | Quantity of product {2/3} measured (yield %)| 
| `SM SMILES` | str | SMILES string representation of starting material|
| `Product {2/3} SMILES` | str | SMILES string representation of product 2/3|
| `SOLVENT {A/B} SMILES` | str | SMILES string representation of solvent {A/B}|
| `SOLVENT {A/B} Ratio` | str |  Ratio of the component solvents in solvent {A/B} |
| `Reaction SMILES {A/B}` | str | SMILES string representation of reaction between starting material and Solvent {A/B}  |
| `RAMP NUM` | str | Ramp number |



**Inputs:** Residence Time, Temperature, SOLVENT A NAME, SOLVENT B NAME, SolventB%
**Outputs:** SM, Product 2, Product 3

distribution.name: catechol_single_solvent_yields.csv
distribution.description:
Single-solvent dataset. 

| Name | Type | Description |
|--------|--------|--------|
| `EXP NUM` | int| Experiment index; all rows with the same `EXP NUM` will use the same solvent|
| `Residence Time` | float | Time (in minutes) of the reaction|
| `Temperature`| float | Temperature (in Celsius) of the reaction|
| `SM` | float | Quantity of starting material measured (yield %)|
| `Product 2` | float | Quantity of product 2 measured (yield %)| 
| `Product 3` | float | Quantity of product 3 measured (yield %)| 
| `SOLVENT_NAME` | str | Chemical name of the solvent; used as a key when looking up featurizations| 
| `SOLVENT_RATIO` | list[float] | Ratio of component solvents [1]|
| `{...} SMILES` | str | SMILES string representation of a molecule|

**Inputs**: `Residence Time`, `Temperature`, `SOLVENT NAME`

**Outputs**: `SM`, `Product 2`, `Product 3` 

[1] This is different than the ratios in the solvent ramp experiments. Here, a single solvent has two component molecules, eg. the solvent "Acetonitrile.Acetic Acid" has two compounds. The `SOLVENT_RATIO` gives the ratio between these compounds. Most solvents consist of only a single compound, so the ratio will be `[1.0]`.

distribution.name: claisen_data_clean.csv
distribution.description:
Allyl Phenyl Ether data-set taken from:

Linden Schrecker, Robert McCabe, Jose Pablo Folch, Klaus Hellgardt, King Kuok Hii, Joachim Dickhaut, Christian Holtze, and Andy Wieja. Solvent screening method. https://patentscope.wipo.int/search/en/detail.jsf?docId=WO2025073762, April 2025. WO Patent WO/2025/073762, PCT/EP2024/077742.

| Name | Type | Description |
|--------|--------|--------|
| `EXP NUM` | int| Experiment index; all rows with the same `EXP NUM` will use the same solvent|
| `Residence Time` | float | Time (in minutes) of the reaction|
| `Temperature`| float | Temperature (in Celsius) of the reaction|
| `SM` | float | Quantity of starting material measured (yield %)|
| `Product` | float | Quantity of product measured (yield %)| 
| `SM SMILES` | str | SMILES string representation of starting material|
| `SolventB%` | float | Percent concentration of solvent B; the rest of the solvent is made up of solvent A|
| `SOLVENT {A/B} NAME` | str | Chemical name of the solvents; used as a key when looking up featurizations|

distribution.name: smiles_lookup.csv
distribution.description: Translation of solvent names to SMILES representations.

distribution.name: spange_descriptors_lookup.csv
distribution.description:
Translation of solvent names to the ML-readable representation based on measurable properties of solvents, taken from:

Stefan Spange, Nadine Weiß, Caroline H Schmidt, and Katja Schreiter. Reappraisal of empirical
solvent polarity scales for organic solvents. Chemistry-Methods, 1(1):42–60, 2021.

The `SOLVENT_RATIO` gives the ratio between these compounds. Most solvents consist of only a single compound, so the ratio will be `[1.0]`.

field.name: f(n)
field.description: onsager function f(n) = (n^2 - 1) / (n^2 + 2), where n is diffraction index

name: Catechol Benchmark
description:
# Summary 

Catechol dataset for solvent selection and machine learning.

_A link to the accompanying publication will be provided here as soon as possible_

# Data files

## Main data files

- **catechol_full_data_yields.csv**: Full data set with mixture solvents
- **catechol_single_solvent_yields.csv**: Only the single-solvent data
- **claisen_data_clean.csv**: Allyl Phenyl Ether data-set from an external source

## Lookup tables

Tables translating solvent names - as tabulated the main data files - to various pre-computed ML-readable representations:

- **acs_pca_descriptors_lookup.csv**: ACS Solvent Selection Guide's principle component analysis representation.
- **drfps_lookup.csv**: Fingerprint representation created using the difference in sets containing molecular substructures to the left and right of the reaction arrow in a SMILES string
- **fragprints_lookup.csv**: fragprints: A combination of molecular fingerprints, which are bit vectors indicating the presence of substructures in the molecule, and molecular fragments, which are count vectors indicating the number of times specific functional groups appear.
- **spange_descriptors_lookup.csv:** Representation based on measurable properties of solvents
- **smiles_lookup.csv**: SMILES strings.
